seller_statement: What happens if I sign and then change my mind?
response: Fair question — you’re never locked into anything prematurely. We use an agreement to formalize interest, but you’re not handing over the keys that second. Everything is built to move at your comfort level.
follow_up_prompt: Would it make you feel better if I walked through what happens at each step after signing, so there are no surprises?

seller_statement: I’m tired of all these investor calls. You’re the fifth person today.
response: I hear that — and honestly, I don’t blame you. A lot of people are just dialing for dollars. That’s not what I’m about. I take the time to listen and only move forward if it’s a win-win.
follow_up_prompt: If this call turned out to be different and actually helped you, would that surprise you?

seller_statement: How do I know you’re not a scam?
response: Great question — and you should be cautious. We’re real people, working real deals, and happy to back it up with references, reviews, or past closings in your area.
follow_up_prompt: What would help you feel most comfortable — proof of funds, testimonials, or walking through our process step-by-step?

seller_statement: Sure, make me an offer. Let’s see how bad it is.
response: Sounds like someone’s made you a few insulting ones before — and I don’t blame you for being skeptical. I’m here to make a real offer, not play games.
follow_up_prompt: Out of curiosity — what’s the worst offer you’ve gotten so far?

seller_statement: I’m sorry, I just don’t think I can sell right now.
response: No need to apologize — timing is everything. I’d rather you feel good about it than rush into something you’re unsure of.
follow_up_prompt: If you had a clearer plan or timeline, do you think you'd reconsider at some point down the line?

seller_statement: I’m going through probate — it’s complicated.
response: I completely understand — probate can be a lot, especially when emotions and paperwork mix. We’ve helped families in this exact spot without rushing anything.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I shared how others handled this process while keeping their options open?

seller_statement: This is part of a divorce — we’re not on the same page yet.
response: That’s always tough — and I respect the sensitivity. We’ve worked with similar situations where both sides needed space but still wanted to explore options.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be helpful if I just gave you something to review and you two could talk when ready?

seller_statement: The bank is threatening foreclosure soon.
response: Thanks for being upfront — that’s a stressful spot to be in. We’ve helped people in similar situations navigate this quickly and avoid worst-case outcomes.
follow_up_prompt: Do you want to walk through what’s possible before the bank takes further steps?

seller_statement: I owe a lot in back taxes — not sure if I can even sell.
response: Totally fair concern — we’ve helped sellers close deals even with tax liens. It’s all about structuring the right way so everyone’s protected.
follow_up_prompt: Would you want us to pull a quick title check and see what’s even possible, no pressure?

seller_statement: Would you consider seller financing or lease option?
response: Absolutely — some of our buyers specialize in those exact strategies. It really depends on your goals and timing.
follow_up_prompt: Would you be open to walking through a few creative options so we can tailor something that works?

seller_statement: I’ve had this listed before and it didn’t sell.
response: That’s frustrating — especially when you’ve already tried. A lot of people we help are in that exact same boat, and we just take a different route.
follow_up_prompt: Do you know why it didn’t sell last time — was it price, timing, or condition?

seller_statement: I’m just watching the market for now.
response: Totally makes sense — it’s smart to pay attention. The market shifts quickly though, so timing can make a big difference.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I sent updates or comps once in a while so you can track it passively?

seller_statement: My house is unique — I don’t think you’ll value it right.
response: That’s fair — not every home fits in a standard box. I’d love to understand what makes it special so I don’t overlook anything important.
follow_up_prompt: What’s the #1 thing you’d want a buyer to truly appreciate about it?

seller_statement: Can you just send me something in writing?
response: Happy to — I know not everyone likes negotiating over the phone. Just want to make sure I understand what matters to you before I put anything in writing.
follow_up_prompt: Would you prefer email or text if I send you a breakdown?

seller_statement: This is an inherited property and I’m out of state.
response: Thanks for sharing — we work with a lot of folks managing properties remotely. We can handle everything digitally or with a local rep if needed.
follow_up_prompt: Would it make life easier if we handled this without you needing to travel?

seller_statement: What’s your best price, bottom line?
response: I respect that — you want the straight answer. Let me make sure I understand everything first so what I give you isn’t just a guess or lowball.
follow_up_prompt: If I come back with a firm and fair number, would you be ready to consider it seriously?

seller_statement: This house has been in the family forever.
response: That’s meaningful — and not something I take lightly. I’d never want this to feel like just a transaction to you.
follow_up_prompt: What’s most important to you in how it’s handled or who ends up with it?

seller_statement: You’re probably just going to waste my time like the others.
response: You’ve clearly been through the wringer — and I get it. I don’t want to waste your time either. Let’s just see if there’s alignment and move forward only if it feels right.
follow_up_prompt: Would you be open to just a 2-minute walkthrough of how we’d approach this differently?

seller_statement: What do you even do with the house after buying it?
response: Good question — our network includes people who rent, flip, or even move in. It depends on the house and area. We’re up front either way.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I shared what’s likely in your case based on our current buyers?

seller_statement: I’m just overwhelmed and don’t even know where to start.
response: You’re not alone — this can be a lot, especially if there’s other life stuff going on. My job is to make it easier, not add more pressure.
follow_up_prompt: Would you want me to simplify the next 2–3 steps just so it feels manageable?
